issue_summary: [Chatbot] Improve language detection for short messages (numbers, emails)
issue_description: ProblemThe language detection in AbstractAgent fails when the last message is a number, email, or other short data without linguistic context. This causes incorrect language detection, particularly noticeable with Hotel Bania (PL) where responses sometimes appear in English instead of Slovak.Root CauseThe detectLanguage() method in AbstractAgent.php (lines 172-178) only analyzes the last message from the conversation. When this message is:A numberAn email addressOther non-linguistic dataThe detector cannot properly identify the language and may default incorrectly.Proposed SolutionMessage validation before detection - Check if the message is suitable for language detection:Minimum length (e.g., >10 characters)Contains letters (not just digits/special characters)Not an email/URLMulti-message context - Analyze the last 3-5 user messages instead of just one to have more linguistic contextFallback to existing language - When detection isn't possible (e.g., for numbers/emails), preserve the previously established conversation language instead of trying to detectSkip detection for non-linguistic input - Return null or skip language change when the input is clearly not suitable for language detectionTechnical DetailsFile: app/Chatbot/Agents/AbstractAgent.phpMethod: detectLanguage() (lines 172-178)Related: DetectLanguage class implementationExpected BehaviorNumbers, emails, and short non-linguistic inputs should not trigger language changesThe system should maintain the previously established language contextLanguage detection should use multiple messages for better accuracy when needed
